Articles.Content:
Dear KSP Players,

 I have been wondering more & more about the scenarios provided in-game, more specifically the crafts, that are used within. I'd like to play around with them, but in my own saved game. So I ask you now, is there any way to download a craft file containing the entire station 1 &/or Kerbal 11? (as for the 11, I mean with both modules docked, & with the station, the entire setup?)

If it's at all possible I'd love to have it, or at least know how to get it.

If I can download both in their complete forms directly, I will give +10000 karma.

P.S. They should be in notepad formats for ultimate reward. I can change them on my own, thanks.

The scenarios are actually saved games, inside a " Scenarios" folder! Just browse there on your file explorer, look for the folder "Ships", and merge it with the same folder on your savegame ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

But they're not in there!

It won't let me post attachments, but I can email a pic.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-23T13:27:59Z" title="03/23/2015 01:27  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 23, 2015</time> by AlextheBodacious**

Really? My bad then. 

I'm not home, but if noone gives a better answer soon I'll check it out when I get there.

I don't see them in there anywhere.

There was a mod(app?) I saw mentioned recently that allowed one to extract craft files from saved game files. Maybe that's the way to go.

Happy landings!

I think you need to extract it from the quicksave itself.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> I don't see them in there anywhere.
> There was a mod(app?) I saw mentioned recently that allowed one to extract craft files from saved game files. Maybe that's the way to go.
> 
> Happy landings!

But what's it called?

> 
> I think you need to extract it from the quicksave itself.
> - - - Updated - - -
> 
> But what's it called?

THis is correct. Found this, but am not sure if this is what you are looking for.

[https://kerbaledit.codeplex.com/](https://kerbaledit.codeplex.com/)

If you make a new save, then copy the .sfs file in scenarios to the quicksave file in the new save you can play the ships in a normal save.(I can't test it right now, tell me if it works).

Good luck; and welcome to the forums!

Also you can try inserting those crafts directly into your persistent.sfs

Here I have extracted two crafts - [Space Station 1](http://pastebin.com/gURpjddn) and [Kerbal XX](http://pastebin.com/Wnj2jD2B)

You can copy and paste them into your persistent.sfs near any other VESSEL. It should make them appear in your savegame.

Please, notify us if this will work.

> 
> If you make a new save, then copy the .sfs file in scenarios to the quicksave file in the new save you can play the ships in a normal save.(I can't test it right now, tell me if it works).
> Good luck; and welcome to the forums!

I'm past this level by infinity.

Also, I've been on the forums for a while but it won't change my status, I don't want to be rude but please don't welcome me.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> ;1802235']Also you can try inserting those crafts directly into your persistent.sfs
> Here I have extracted two crafts - [Space Station 1](http://pastebin.com/gURpjddn) and [Kerbal XX](http://pastebin.com/Wnj2jD2B)
> 
> You can copy and paste them into your persistent.sfs near any other VESSEL. It should make them appear in your savegame.
> 
> Please' date=' notify us if this will work.[/quote']
> 
> Thank you so much! I've been trying so hard to but failed on this every time.

> 
> But what's it called?

Check out [this thread](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/107142-Possible-to-Save-Ship-from-Persistence-File).

Hope this helps.

Happy landings!
So now the only problem is to change the orbiting stats to being available in the VAB, because I pasted it into a save, but it started where it was.

> 
> Dear KSP Players,
>  I have been wondering more & more about the scenarios provided in-game, more specifically the crafts, that are used within. I'd like to play around with them, but in my own saved game. So I ask you now, is there any way to download a craft file containing the entire station 1 &/or Kerbal 11? (as for the 11, I mean with both modules docked, & with the station, the entire setup?)
> 
> If it's at all possible I'd love to have it, or at least know how to get it.
> 
> If I can download both in their complete forms directly, I will give +10000 karma.
> 
> P.S. They should be in notepad formats for ultimate reward. I can change them on my own, thanks.

> 
> I don't see them in there anywhere.
> There was a mod(app?) I saw mentioned recently that allowed one to extract craft files from saved game files. Maybe that's the way to go.
> 
> Happy landings!

> 
> But what's it called?

You might be referring to my utility, InFlightShipSave. You can find it [in this thread](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/97285-KSP-v0-90-Stock-Bug-Fix-Modules-%28Release-v0-1-7d-28-Feb-15%29-Misc-Utilities-%2818-Jan-15%29?p=1486867&viewfull=1#post1486867). I have not tried it on any of the scenario craft, but I imagine it should work. I do not do any "scenario" or "difficulty" setting checks when saving the files, and I don't believe those checks are embedded within the save functions.

I haven't updated it in a bit, but it's still a work in progress. The one major feature that's missing right now is correct handling of docking ports. It will save out files with docking ports, but they won't be properly constructed for the editor. Which basically means docking ports might require a little bit of .craft file manual editing until that bit is updated.

Not sure if that's what you're looking for.

Cheers,

~Claw

> 
> You might be referring to my utility, InFlightShipSave. You can find it [in this thread](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/97285-KSP-v0-90-Stock-Bug-Fix-Modules-%28Release-v0-1-7d-28-Feb-15%29-Misc-Utilities-%2818-Jan-15%29?p=1486867&viewfull=1#post1486867). I have not tried it on any of the scenario craft, but I imagine it should work. I do not do any "scenario" or "difficulty" setting checks when saving the files, and I don't believe those checks are embedded within the save functions.
> I haven't updated it in a bit, but it's still a work in progress. The one major feature that's missing right now is correct handling of docking ports. It will save out files with docking ports, but they won't be properly constructed for the editor. Which basically means docking ports might require a little bit of .craft file manual editing until that bit is updated.
> 
> Not sure if that's what you're looking for.
> 
> Cheers,
> 
> ~Claw

I've used it, but it seems to bug out a little. I'll try some more, hope it works.

Thanks anyway.
